review: Prior to having my Google Chromecast I was using a very long HDMI cable (I am living in an apartment so I do believe it's either 25 or 30 feet long). Transporting my laptop is a pain (as the battery doesn't last very long), so it always stays on my desk in my office. The HDMI cable worked, but it meant I had a wire running out of my office and across my living room to the TV. I had to be very careful not to trip on it. With the Chromecast I can play from my laptop OR my iPad.The only problem for me is that you are limited to what you can watch/see via Chromecast. With my HDMI cable I could make my TV pretty much a bigger monitor and do whatever I would typically do on the computer on it (my mouse and keyboard are wireless and will work from my living room). I really wish I could do that with the Chromecast, especially for playing music (without having to put on YouTube videos).

Love it!You will need a decent wireless internet signal to make it work.
